wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Arthur Colegate (1884 – 10 September 1956) was a British Conservative Party politician who served in the House of Commons as a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1941 to 1945 and from 1950 to 1955.

response: * Sir Arthur Colegate, former UK Conservative Party politician
*Arthur Colegate - Conservative politician, lived at Church Aston Manor at time he was MP for The Wrekin 1940-45.

Born in Lincolnshire, Colegate’s father was Sir Arthur Colegate, while her mother was Winifred Mary, a daughter of Sir William Worsley, 3rd Baronet, and the widow of Captain Francis Percy Campbell Pemberton of the 2nd Life Guards, who had been killed in action in the First World War.Charles Mosley, ed., Burke's Peerage, Baronetage & Knighthood (Burke's Peerage, 2003), p. 4244 She was educated at Runton Hill School in Norfolk. In 1952, Colegate, in partnership with Anthony Blond, set up the publishing firm, Anthony Blond (London) Ltd.
* Sir Arthur Colegate, Governor and Conservative party MP
*Arthur Colegate, , Member of Parliament for the Wrekin Division, 1941–1945, and for the Burton Division since 1950. For political and public services.

The Wrekin by-election of 1941 was held on 26 September 1941.  The by-election was held due to the death of the incumbent Conservative MP, James Baldwin-Webb.  It was won by the Conservative candidate Arthur Colegate.
